member.summary: Marks a blob as complete

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.IChunkStrategy.Stop
member.summary: Send a stop signal

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.ReadStreamChunkStrategy
member.summary: The ReadStreamChunkStrategy will get the available job chunks and receive the blobs in order NOTE: To use this strategy the job must be created with the JobChunkClientProcessingOrderGuarantee.IN_ORDER

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.WriteRandomAccessChunkStrategy
member.summary: The WriteRandomAccessChunkStrategy will allocate chunks as needed and return the allocated blobs

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.WriteRandomAccessChunkStrategy.GetObjectsNotInCache
member.summary: Filtering the objects that are already in cache, this helps us when using aggregating jobs to determinate which object are related to the current running job.
member.returns: A new list of objects to be processed by the running job

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.ReadRandomAccessChunkStrategy
member.summary: The ReadRandomAccessChunkStrategy will get the available job chunks and allocate those chunks

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.ReadRandomAccessChunkStrategy.EnumerateTransferItemBatches
member.summary: This generator method yields batches of transfer items. After yielding a batch, it blocks until the consumer passes each of the batch items to CompleteBlob. It does so using the _numberInProgress countdown event. If the consumer calls Stop, the generator terminates.

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.WriteNoAllocateChunkStrategy
member.summary: The WriteNoAllocateChunkStrategy will return all the blobs that were returned in the JobResponse without allocate cache space for them in BlackPearl

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ChunkStrategies.WriteStreamChunkStrategy
member.summary: The WriteStreamChunkStrategy will allocate chunks one at a time for each stream in the job and return the allocated blobs

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.ReadStreamHelperStrategy
member.summary: The ReadStreamHelperStrategy bundle ReadStreamChunkStrategy with ReadStreamStreamFactory

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.StreamFactory.ReadRandomAccessStreamFactory`1
member.summary: Create one stream and receiving blobs in parallel using stream seeking

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.StreamFactory.ReadStreamStreamFactory
member.summary: Create one stream and GET blobs in order without seeking

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.StreamFactory.WriteRandomAccessStreamFactory
member.summary: Create a stream for each blob and transfer blobs in parallel

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.StreamFactory.WriteStreamStreamFactory
member.summary: Create one stream and transfer blobs in order without seeking

member.param: The root directory within which to save objects.

member.summary: Creates a function that can open a file stream for writing. For use with IJob.Transfer(getter). Creates all directories needed to save the file.
member.param: The root directory within which to save objects.
A string to prepend to the filename.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.FileHelpers.BuildFilePutter(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a function that can open a file stream for reading. For use with IJob.Transfer(putter). Backwards-compatible signature before prefix was added
member.param: The root directory within which to read objects.

member.summary: Creates a function that can open a file stream for reading. For use with IJob.Transfer(putter).
member.param: The root directory within which to read objects.
A string to prepend to the object name.

member.name: P:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.JobId
member.summary: The id that allows the client to track job status and recover or delete jobs in the case of a failure during transfer.

member.name: P:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.BucketName
member.summary: The name of the bucket that this job is transferring to.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.WithMaxParallelRequests(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Must always be called before the Transfer method.
Specifies The maximum number of simultaneous transfers to or from the server for this particular job.
member.returns: This IJob instance.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.WithCancellationToken(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Must always be called before the Transfer method.
Allows the client to stop transferring to a job using a CancellationTokenSource. Note that this does not cancel a job, and the job can be resumed later. If you'd like to cancel a job, use IDs3Client.DeleteJob().
member.returns: This IJob instance.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.WithMetadata(Ds3.Helpers.IMetadataAccess)
member.summary:
Must always be called before the Transfer method.
Allows the client to add meta-data to objects.
member.returns: This IJob instance.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.Transfer(System.Func{`1,System.IO.Stream})
member.summary:
Performs all GETs or PUTs for the job (depending on the type of job).
This method uses DS3 cache handling requests to efficiently transfer objects and handles multiplexing single object streams when the DS3 job response splits individual objects into multiple requests. It also performs requests in parallel for situations where doing so can improve performance.
member.param: Opens a stream for a given transfer item.

member.name: E:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.DataTransferred
member.summary: Fires handlers with the amount of additional data that's been transferred when a part of a job is transferred.

member.name: E:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.ItemCompleted
member.summary: Fires handlers with the name of each transferred item as their transfers finish.

member.name: E:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.MetadataListener
member.summary: Fires handlers with an object name and the meta-data associated with it.

member.name: E:Ds3.Helpers.IBaseJob`2.OnFailure
member.summary: A failure occurred while transferring a blob that we cannot recover from in the helper functions. Fires handlers with an object name, offset and the exception thrown

member.name: P:Ds3.Helpers.IPartialReadJob.AllItems
member.summary: All of the items that this job will transfer. For full objects, this is the full object as a single Ds3PartialObject.

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.ProgressTrackers.JobItemTracker`1
member.summary: A "job item" represents one of the things that the SDK client requests. In the case of regular GET and PUT jobs, this is an object. In the case of a partial object GET, this is a requested byte range for an object. If the user requests multiple byte ranges for the same object, each range counts as a "job item";

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.StartWriteJob(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ds3.Models.Ds3Object},System.Nullable{System.Int64},Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.IHelperStrategy{System.String})
member.summary: Runs a DS3 bulk PUT request with a set of objects and returns an interface that can PUT individual objects efficiently to the server.
member.param: The name of the bucket to put the objects to.
The object names and sizes to put.
The (optional) maximum size for the parts of the objects to transmit.
member.returns: An IJob implementation that can put each object per the DS3 protocol.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.StartReadJob(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ds3.Models.Ds3Object},Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.IHelperStrategy{System.String})
member.summary: Runs a DS3 bulk GET request with a set of objects and returns an interface that can GET individual objects efficiently from the server.
member.param: The name of the bucket to get the objects from.
The object names to get.
member.returns: An IJob implementation that can get each object per the DS3 protocol.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.StartReadAllJob(System.String,Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.IHelperStrategy{System.String})
member.summary: Runs a DS3 bulk GET request for all of the objects in a bucket.
member.param: The name of the bucket to get the objects from.
member.returns: An IJob implementation that can get each object per the DS3 protocol.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.StartPartialReadJob(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ds3.Models.Ds3PartialObject},Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.IHelperStrategy{Ds3.Models.Ds3PartialObject})
member.summary:
Runs a DS3 bulk GET request with a set of partial object transfers and returns an interface that can GET individual object parts efficiently from the server.
Note that you can get multiple ranges within the same object at the same time, but those ranges must be non-overlapping.
member.param: The name of the bucket to get the objects from.
The list of full objects to get.
The object parts to get.
member.returns: The IPartialReadJob implementation that can get each partial object per the DS3 protocol.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.ListObjects(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns information about all of the objects in a bucket.
Note that this method requests 1,000 objects at a time as they are consumed. Thus, if a bucket contains 2,500 objects and you call helpers.ListObjects("bucket").Take(1500).ToList() then the client will issue exactly two requests.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.ListObjects(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns information about all of the objects in a bucket whose names start with a given prefix.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.EnsureBucketExists(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a bucket if it does not exist.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.RecoverWriteJob(System.Guid,Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.IHelperStrategy{System.String})
member.summary: Determines the state of an existing bulk PUT job and returns an interface that can PUT the remaining objects efficiently.
member.returns: An IJob implementation that can put each object per the DS3 protocol.

member.name: M:Ds3.Helpers.IDs3ClientHelpers.RecoverReadJob(System.Guid,Ds3.Helpers.Strategies.IHelperStrategy{System.String})
member.summary: Determines the state of an existing bulk GET job and returns an interface that can GET the remaining objects efficiently.
member.returns: An IJob implementation that can put each object per the DS3 protocol.

member.name: T:Ds3.Helpers.IJob
member.summary: Provides a simple API to efficiently transfer objects for a bulk job.

member.name: T:Ds3.Models.Crc32
member.summary: Implements a 32-bit CRC hash algorithm
member.remarks: Crc32 should only be used for backward compatibility with older file formats and algorithms. It is not secure enough for new applications. If you need to call multiple times for the same data either use the HashAlgorithm interface or remember that the result of one Compute call needs to be ~ (XOR) before being passed in as the seed for the next Compute call.

member.name: T:Ds3.Models.Crc32C
member.summary: Implements CRC (Castagnoli) Hash as a checksum
member.remarks: Crc32 Uses teh same methods but a different polynomial which has been optimized for computation in Intel hardware

member.name: M:Ds3.Runtime.HttpHelper.PercentEncodePath(System.String)
member.summary:
Implements percent encoding of a URI path as specified by RFC 3986 Section 2.1 http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.1
This method percent encodes the UTF-8 representation of all characters except those specified as "Unreserved" by the RFC or a forward slash (/).
We've implemented this method because all of the available built-in .NET framework methods are incomplete in one way or another.

member.name: M:Ds3.Runtime.HttpHelper.PercentEncodePath(System.String,System.Char[])
member.summary:
Implements percent encoding of a URI path as specified by RFC 3986 Section 2.1 http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.1
This method percent encodes the UTF-8 representation of all characters except those specified as "Unreserved" by the RFC or specified in the "allowedChars" parame1ter.
We've implemented this method because all of the available built-in .NET framework methods are incomplete in one way or another.

Credentials with which to specify identity and sign requests.

member.name: M:Ds3.Ds3Builder.WithProxy(System.Uri)
member.summary: Used to specify an HTTP proxy.

member.name: M:Ds3.Ds3Builder.WithRedirectRetries(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sometimes the DS3 server isn't ready to service a request. In these situations it will periodically respond with a 307 redirect to keep the connection alive. The SDK makes this transparent if it happens up to RedirectRetries times. Use this to specify a limit on how many times this should happen before throwing an exception.

member.name: M:Ds3.Ds3Builder.WithCopyBufferSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines how many bytes to copy at a time to and from input streams when performing object GET and PUT operations.

member.name: M:Ds3.Ds3Builder.WithReadWriteTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies how long to wait in milliseconds for an HTTP request or response to transfer.

member.name: M:Ds3.Ds3Builder.WithRequestTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies how long to wait in milliseconds for the server to respond once the HTTP request has been fully sent.

member.name: M:Ds3.Ds3Builder.WithConnectionLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies how many concurrent connections we can open to a single host.

member.name: M:Ds3.Ds3Builder.Build
member.summary: Creates the Ds3Client using the specified parameters.

member.name: P:Ds3.Resources.StreamUnavailableException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Job tried to open stream for key '{0}', but that key should not be available. This is probably a bug in the helpers..

member.name: P:Ds3.Resources.TooManyRedirectsException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Too many redirects..

member.name: P:Ds3.Resources.TooManyRetriesForPartialData
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Exhausted retries for retrieving data when partial data was received..

member.name: P:Ds3.Resources.XmlResponseErrorException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Encountered an error while reading XML response: "{0}".
